name: RerunGithubWorkflow
description:
Initiates the rerun of a specific GitHub workflow.

Use this tool to re-run a GitHub workflow run by providing its ID. Requires authentication with a token having 'repo' scope, or 'actions:write' permission for GitHub Apps.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The GitHub account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: workflow_run_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run to be re-run.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run.

parameters.name: enable_debug_logging
parameters.description: Enable debug logging for the workflow re-run by setting to true.

value_schema.description: Whether to enable debug logging for the re-run.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run.

parameters.name: enable_debug_logging

value_schema.description: Whether to enable debug logging for the re-run.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
